title: EastEnders spoilers: What is wrong with Honey as eating disorder fears grow?
text:
Honey Mitchell (Emma Barton) in EastEnders is known on the Square as the kind, caring mum of two who looks on the outside to have her life in order, but recent scenes have seen Honey act different from her usual self, which has left viewers feeling concerned for her welfare.

Since splitting with Billy Mitchell (Perry Fenwick), Honey has been in a relationship with local dentist Adam Bateman (Stephen Rahman-Hughes) and for a while it seemed like everything was going smoothly. However when sisters Iqra (Priya Davdra) and Habiba (Rukku Nahar) arrived on Albert Square, it was soon revealed that Adam and Habiba had been interested in each other for a very long time, which led to an affair storyline between the two of them.

It’s safe to say Honey had been in denial that Adam and Habiba were having an affair. After Billy saw them kissing, he confronted Honey about it but she continued to gloss over everything. Honey asked Adam if the rumours about him and Habiba were true, but he denied everything.

Advertisement

Advertisement

With Honey’s demeanour changing over the last few weeks, it’s clear that she’s struggling to come to terms with Adam’s betrayal. But is there more to this than meets the eye?

She’s planning revenge

Honey definitely knows there is evidence to suggest that Adam and Habiba have been seeing each other, she knows about Billy seeing the two of them kiss, and she also saw CCTV footage from the Minute Mart of Adam stroking Habiba’s hair, but Adam’s sweet talking and gift buying has meant Honey is yet to fully confront Adam about his sleazy behaviour. Could Honey be planning to get revenge on Adam so people can finally see that the dentist with the perfect smile isn’t so perfect after all?

She’s planning to run away

With actress Emma Barton currently spending her weekends on Strictly Come Dancing, a short-term exit could be on the cards for Honey. If she doesn’t confront Adam about the affair, could she run away from Walford leaving him to put two and two together? We have seen Habiba try to convince Honey that she is better off with someone else, will she finally realise this and flee Albert Square?

She’s pushing Adam away deliberately

We have seen Honey struggle to accept that Adam hasn’t been trustworthy, if she continues to struggle with accepting Adam’s lies, could she deliberately push Adam away so he leaves her to make the inevitable confrontation a little easier?

Advertisement

Advertisement

She’s developing an eating disorder

Recent episodes saw Honey have dinner with Adam, Iqra, Habiba, Mariam (Indira Joshi) and Arshad (Madhav Sharma). In what seemed like a perfectly normal dinner (besides the fact that Adam was having an affair with Habiba but you know, minor details!), Honey seemed reluctant to try the dishes that had been prepared. After anxiously excusing herself to go to the bathroom, Adam realised when Honey returned that she had also brushed her teeth. Remembering how Honey was before the dinner, viewers started to become concerned and thought that Honey could be developing an eating disorder.

With Honey saying to Habiba: ‘when you’ve had as many knocks as I’ve had, looking in the mirror simply isn’t important anymore’ and her self esteem at a low as she compares herself to Habiba – could she be hiding an upsetting and dangerous secret?

Eating disorder charity Beat said: ‘Low self-esteem, along with many other possible factors, may put someone at a higher risk of developing an eating disorder.’

Eating Disorders - the statistics It is estimated that 1.25 million people in the UK have an eating disorder

Anorexia has the highest mortality rate of any mental illness

Studies suggest that up to 25% of people with eating disorders could be male

Some symptoms of bulimia – irritability, disappearing during or soon after eating, mood swings

Some symptoms of anorexia – eating very slowly, missing meals, avoiding eating with other people

Some symptoms of binge eating disorder – social withdrawal, eating very rapidly, buying lots of food

There is no doubt Honey certainly has something on her mind right now, but what it could be is yet to be revealed. What we do know is that Honey potentially feels like she doesn’t have anyone she can talk to right now. Could she talk to Billy or will her pride get in the way? How far will things go before someone realises something is wrong? Will Honey be in serious danger by the time someone does?

Advertisement

You can find more information and support in relation to eating disorders by visiting Beat’s website.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: She is hiding a troubling secret.
